strings.Value: "Fine, we'll go there as soon as we have time to spare."
"I don't want to have anything to do with those two."
"I'm absolutely sure. Let them both go to Hell — or worse."
"Looks like we're finally about to see another part of that story about Darven and Linxia. But this time, a peaceful solution seems an unlikely outcome." {n}Linzi sighs.{/n}

"Our esteemed {d|c41 Linxia Rejected}captain{/d} has sent us a {g|darven_message}message{/g}. Here, take a look. He writes that he's built a city near your border, and invites you to be his guest. But this invitation has a foul smell, if you ask me — Linxia is bound to be there too. I can bet that these two will be at each other's throat even before we show up."

"That wretched {d|c41 Linxia Welcomed}book-burner{/d} has sent us a {g|linxia_message}message{/g}. Here you are — I hope you enjoy it. She's softened her tone a bit, and now she's asking us to help her. She writes that Darven has built a city near your border. So she's going to assault it, and she's decided that we'll volunteer to be her reinforcement."
{n}Linzi suddenly realizes something.{/n} "You won't be offended that I read your letter, right? It's just that the courier brought in an unsealed paper, so I just..."
"But I just wanted to make sure that the case was really serious. So you wouldn't get distracted over nothing. Uhh…"
"I guess we should hurry, or they'll probably kill each other before we even get there."
"Well, that's your right. To tell you the truth, I'm not a big fan of either of them."
"Are you sure? Maybe we should at least go and see what's going on there? You know, for the sake of curiosity."
